turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to schedule a doctor's appointment for myself.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello. I can assist with that. Could you please provide your full name and date of birth so I can access your profile?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my name is Sarah Johnson, and my date of birth is 05/15/1988.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Sarah. I have located your profile. What is the reason for your visit today, and do you have a specific doctor or specialty you need to see?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's for a follow-up on some blood work. I need to see Dr. Adams, my primary care physician. This is getting a bit tedious, can't your system just know I usually see him?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I apologize for the inconvenience, Sarah. While I can see your previous appointments, confirming your preferred doctor each time helps ensure accuracy, especially if you might need to see a specialist for this issue. Thank you for confirming Dr. Adams. Searching for available appointments with Dr. Adams... I see he has openings on Tuesday, November 12th at 11:00 AM and Thursday, November 14th at 3:30 PM. Do either of these work for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, neither of those times are great. Why isn't there anything available next week? I thought follow-ups were supposed to be quick.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern, Sarah. Dr. Adams' schedule is quite full, and availability depends on cancellations and pre-booked appointments. I have only listed the standard openings I see in the system for the next two weeks. I cannot provide specific reasons why certain days are booked.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that's frustrating. Fine, I guess I'll take the Tuesday, November 12th at 11:00 AM one then. Please book that.
